title: Week Review & Integration
goal: Consolidate Week 2 by using all vocabulary and grammar in realistic scenarios.

sections.content:
Warm-up (2-3 min)

Vocative rapid-fire — say the Lojban:

1. Hello         → ?
2. Goodbye       → ?
3. I am [name]   → ?
4. Thanks        → ?
5. You're welcome → ?

(Answers: coi, co'o, mi'e .name., ki'e, je'e)

Now say them all in sequence without looking.

Grammar Summary (3-4 min)

What You Learned This Week

1. Names (cmevla)

  • Must end in consonant
  • Wrapped in periods: .alis., .bob.
  • Use la to make names into sumti: la .alis.

2. Vocatives

Vocative Meaning Example
coi hello coi la .alis.
co'o goodbye co'o la .bob.
mi'e I am [name] mi'e .tam.
ki'e thanks ki'e la .meris.
je'e acknowledged je'e

3. Names in Bridi

Position Example Meaning
x1 la .alis. cu klama Alice goes.
x2 mi prami la .bob. I love Bob.
Both la .alis. cu tavla la .bob. Alice talks to Bob.

4. Week 2 Gismu

Gismu Place Structure English
cmene x1 is a name for x2 used by x3 name
prenu x1 is a person person
nanmu x1 is a man man
ninmu x1 is a woman woman
verba x1 is a child of x2 child
zdani x1 is a home of x2 home
sutra x1 is fast at x2 fast
barda x1 is big in x2 big

Self-Test (5-6 min)

Part A: Vocabulary (8 points)

Translate to English:

  1. prenu →
  2. zdani →
  3. sutra →
  4. barda →

Translate to Lojban:

  1. man →
  2. woman →
  3. child →
  4. name →
Answers
  1. person
  2. home
  3. fast
  4. big
  5. nanmu
  6. ninmu
  7. verba
  8. cmene

Part B: Vocatives (5 points)

What do you say when...

  1. You meet someone? →
  2. You leave? →
  3. You introduce yourself? →
  4. Someone helps you? →
  5. Someone thanks you? →
Answers
  1. coi (+ la .name.)
  2. co'o
  3. mi'e .yourname.
  4. ki'e
  5. je'e

Part C: Sentence Translation (6 points)

Translate to English:

  1. coi la .alis. .i mi'e .bob.
  2. la .tam. cu nanmu .i la .tam. cu sutra
  3. mi klama la zdani
Answers
  1. Hello, Alice. I'm Bob.
  2. Tom is a man. Tom is fast.
  3. I go home.

Translate to Lojban:

  1. Alice is a woman. Alice is beautiful.
  2. I love Bob. Bob loves me.
  3. Thanks. Goodbye.
Answers
  1. la .alis. cu ninmu .i la .alis. cu melbi
  2. mi prami la .bob. .i la .bob. cu prami mi
  3. ki'e .i co'o

Part D: Build a Conversation (6 points)

Create a 6-line dialogue between you and Alice that includes:

  • A greeting
  • An introduction
  • One statement about yourself
  • One statement about Alice
  • Thanks
  • Goodbye
Example answer 
coi la .alis.
mi'e .yourname.
mi prenu .i mi klama la zdani
la .alis. cu ninmu .i la .alis. cu melbi
ki'e la .alis.
co'o

(Hello Alice. I'm [you]. I'm a person. I go home. Alice is a woman. Alice is beautiful. Thanks, Alice. Goodbye.)

Scoring

Section Points Your Score
Part A 8 ___
Part B 5 ___
Part C 6 ___
Part D 6 ___
Total 25 ___

Interpretation:

  • 23-25: Excellent. Ready for Week 3.
  • 18-22: Good. Review weak areas, then proceed.
  • 13-17: Fair. Revisit Days 3-5 before moving on.
  • Below 13: Repeat Week 2.

Integration Challenge (1-2 min)

Scenario: Meeting a New Person

Imagine you're meeting someone named Sam (.sam.) for the first time. Create a complete interaction:

  1. Greet Sam
  2. Introduce yourself
  3. Say something about yourself (man/woman/person, or an action)
  4. Describe Sam (make something up: fast, good, beautiful)
  5. Thank Sam (for the conversation)
  6. Say goodbye

Example:

coi la .sam.
.i mi'e .yourname.
.i mi prenu .i mi klama la zdani
.i la .sam. cu sutra .i la .sam. cu xamgu
.i ki'e la .sam.
.i co'o

Say your complete interaction aloud without reading.

Week 2 Complete Reference

Gismu (8):

Lojban English Lojban English
cmene name zdani home
prenu person sutra fast
nanmu man barda big
ninmu woman
verba child

Vocatives (5):

Lojban English
coi hello
co'o goodbye
mi'e I am [name]
ki'e thanks
je'e acknowledged

Key Cmavo:

Lojban Function
la marks a name as sumti

Cumulative vocabulary: 20 gismu (12 from Week 1 + 8 from Week 2)

Summary

You completed Week 2. You can now Lojbanize names, greet people with coi and co'o, introduce yourself with mi'e, express thanks with ki'e, and use names in any sumti position. You learned 8 new gismu for people, places, and qualities.

Next week preview: Week 3 introduces questions — xu (yes/no questions), ma (what/who), and how to answer them. You'll start having real back-and-forth conversations.

Congratulations

ki'e do .i do sutra .i do xamgu .i co'o

(Thanks. You are fast. You are good. Goodbye.)

Two weeks complete. You're building real Lojban skills.
